summary: The bill, the Cybersecurity Information Sharing Extension Act, aims to extend the availability of information relating to cybersecurity threats. It amends the Cybersecurity Act of 2015 by extending the effective period from 2025 to 2035. The bill was introduced by Mr. Peters and Mr. Rounds and was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. The bill's stated purpose is to improve the sharing of cybersecurity threat information.
